results.title: Game Masters: Paulina Bozek interview
results.creator_credit: ACMI Media Studio, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Paulina Bozek started her career at Ubisoft in Montreal, Canada, before moving to Sony as the Executive Producer of the ‘SingStar’ franchise for PlayStation. Currently she is CEO and co-founder at INENSUA, responsible for overseeing the creative direction and team management for the development of social games and applications. A self-confessed casual gamer, Paulina studied film and communication and has always been interested in pop culture and the combination of technology and entertainment. In this interview she discusses her preference for working on long term projects, as well as the importance of user feedback and engaging the audience early in the development process.

In this interview Paulina talks about ‘SingStar’, ‘Closet Swap’ and her new project ‘Super Fan’. NB: Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.

results.title: Game Masters: Peter Molyneux interview
results.creator_credit: ACMI Media Studio, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description:
In this interview, featured as part of the ‘Game Masters’ exhibition, Peter Molyneux speaks about his career as a videogame designer. While selling baked beans, a once in a life time opportunity presented itself and Molyneux took advantage of his good fortune. His first game, ‘Populous’, became a huge worldwide success, surprising everyone, including himself. In this interview Peter talks about his inspirations, his work practise and his never-ending fascination with the notion of morality and choice. Now, as Creative Director of Microsoft Game Studios, Molyneux is one of the best known names in the videogames industry. Making his mark as a games designer and programmer, he has been responsible for a string of bestselling games, including ‘Populous’, ‘Dungeon Keeper’, ‘Black and White’ and ‘Fable I, II and III’.

NB: Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.

results.title: Game Masters: Warren Spector interview
results.creator_credit: ACMI Media Studio, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description:
In this interview, featured as part of the ‘Game Masters’ exhibition, Warren Spector speaks about his career as a videogame designer. Warren refers to his days of playing ‘Dungeons and Dragons’ and the influence this has had on him as a vidoegames designer. A great collector of board games and Disney memorabilia, Warren talks with great passion about the importance of archiving and making games a medium worth recognising.

Warren Spector is a master of role playing game design and has been influenced and inspired by films and literature, such as ‘Blade Runner’ and cyberpunk science fiction, he is best known for creating influential titles such as ‘Deus Ex’ and his most recent release, ‘Disney Epic Mickey’.

NB: Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.

results.title: Game Masters: Tim Schafer interview
results.creator_credit: ACMI Content Development, ACMI Media Studio and ACMI
results.brief_description:
In this interview, featured as part of the Game Masters exhibition, Tim Schafer speaks about his career as a game designer, starting at LucasArts and then founding his own production company Double Fine Productions. Tim discusses his influences, drawn heavily from the cultural folk law of Mexico, the psychological study of dreams, his love of heavy metal music and the writing of Raymond Chandler and Kurt Vonnegut Jr. With the progression of emerging technology his game aesthetics and character development have evolved, cementing Tim Schafer and Double Fine Productions’ place in games history.

Tim talks about his inspirations and work practices in developing the following games: ‘Full Throttle’, ‘Grim Fandango’, ‘Psychonauts’ and ‘Brutal Legend’. NB: Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.

results.title: Un Drole de Paroissien = Thank Heaven for Small Favors
results.creator_credit: Jean-Pierre Mocky, Jerome Goulven and Henri Diamant-Berger
results.brief_description:
The Lachaunay family, high-born aristocrats, have fallen on hard times and must resort to stripping off the doors and panelling of their Paris appartment to use as firewood. They are also threatened with eviction, but never waver from their conviction that they were born not to work. One of them, the ultra-religious Georges resorts to stealing money from offertory boxes. This is a wonderfully provocative and anti-clerical comedy, served by a subtle and humourous performance by Bourvil.

Credits: Producers, Henri Diamant-Berger, Jerome Goulven ; director, Jean-Pierre Mocky ; writer, Alain Moury, Michel Servin ; photography, Leonce-Henri Burel ; music, Joseph Kosma ; art direction, Pierre Thyberhein.
Cast: Bourvil, Jean Poiret, Francis Blanche, Jean Yonnel, Jean Tissier, Solange Certain, Denise Peronne, Veronique Nordey, Jean Galland, Bernard Lavallette.

results.title: Shadow of a doubt [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock, Jack H. Skirball and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Film noir is here disconcertingly located in the calm world of small town America with young Charlie becoming attached by telepathic bond to her psychopathic uncle Charlie when he comes to visit her family in Santa Rosa. Cast includes Joseph Cotten, Teresa Wright and Macdonald Carey.

results.title: Play Safe
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board, Video Films and Australian Road Safety Council
results.brief_description: Aimed at children, this film highlights a number of road safety aspects. Don Bradman talks to the children about avoiding accidents, both going and coming from school, and during playtime on the school playground.

results.title: Castleguard Cave
results.creator_credit: Syd Perov, Derek Ford, Haverand Productions and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An adventure film of a different sort - the fascinating record of the exploration of Castleguard Cave under the Columbia Icefield in Banff National Park, an exhausting but irresistible crawl through more than 5 km of dark tunnel, the longest known in Canada. What beckons the members of the expedition, what they find, how they support the physical stress, the nagging doubts, and what their reward is - these are all questions they answer in this film. Award: Milton Keynes, England

results.title: Synthing
results.brief_description: Synthing is the result of years of exploratory work across disciplines. “The Synthing concept puts expressive and energetic body movement in front of a video camera interface to create an engrossing interplay of music and images within the framework of a cybermedium… a synaesthetic compositional tool”, says Gruchy. Synthing, through its use of real-time navigation and interactive technologies, allows real opportunities for audience interaction.

results.title: Ron's story
results.creator_credit: Davide Grassi, Aldo Ivancic and Ron Athey
results.brief_description: Ron’s Story is a video based on the work and obsessions of Los Angeles-based extreme performance artist Ron Athey. The video is comprised of footage filmed at various performances staged at the Kapelica Gallery and the Cultural Centre Cankarjev dom in Ljubljana between 1996 and 2001.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Davide Grassi, Aldo Ivancic and Ron Athey
